text:
Purpose

When a student or staff member travels during the semester and is uncertain about accessing school information from a different country, this list identifies the countries where they will encounter issues.

Detailed Procedure Steps

CN: China DZ: Algeria EG: Egypt ID: Indonesia IQ: Iraq IR: Iran KP: North Korea NG: Nigeria PK: Pakistan RO: Romania RU: Russia TH: Thailand TR: Turkey VN: Vietnam

Access attempts from these countries will be blocked by our systems to comply with legal and security protocols. Exceptions can only be granted through formal review and approval from the Security and Compliance Office.

This policy is subject to regular review and may be updated as necessary to address evolving threats and regulations.

Purpose

The purpose of using JAMF Pro for managing iPads is to streamline and enhance the management of Apple devices within an organization

Releasing iPads to Student – KB0010118: complete Apple Store Unassign & Release process first.

Student forgot password to iPad

Format iPad repurposing

Lost iPad Lock

Roles and Responsibilities

Support:

Primary: L1ServiceDesk – Full Time Associates (assign request item)

Secondary: Desktop Services (assign request item)

Technical Support Services – Access to Console & Application Support

User Services for Support

Prerequisites

JAMF Pro Access – Create IT Support Request

Console- Jamf Pro Login (jamfcloud.com)

Device must be enrolled in Device List

Detailed Procedure Steps

Never guess or assume which system buttons or options to select; always seek guidance if you are uncertain

Procedure: Clearing a Password on an iPad

Step 1: Verify Device Information
preview: Purpose  The purpose of using JAMF Pro for managing iPads is to streamline and enhance the management of Apple devices within an organization  Releasing iPads to Student – KB0010118: complete Apple Store Unassign & Relea

text:
Step 1: Verify Device Information

Description: Confirm the identity of the user requesting the password reset and ensure you have the correct iPad associated with the user. Cross-check the student's or user's ID with the information in the Jamf Pro system.

Responsible Party: IT Administrator or Help Desk Staff

Tools/Resources: Jamf Pro console, User ID documentation

Expected Outcome: Accurate identification of the iPad that needs the password reset.

Step 2: Locate the iPad

Description: When inside Jamf Pro navigate to the "Devices" section in the Jamf Pro console. Search for the iPad by entering the device's name, serial number, or user ID in the search bar.

Responsible Party: IT Administrator

Tools/Resources: Jamf Pro console

Expected Outcome: The correct iPad is found and displayed in the list.

Step 3: Verify Wi-Fi Connectivity
preview: Step 1: Verify Device Information  Description: Confirm the identity of the user requesting the password reset and ensure you have the correct iPad associated with the user. Cross-check the student's or user's ID with th

text:
Step 3: Verify Wi-Fi Connectivity

Description: Ensure that the iPad is connected to a Wi-Fi network, as Jamf Pro requires an active Wi-Fi connection to communicate commands to the device. If the iPad is not connected to Wi-Fi, direct the user to connect to a network. If assistance is needed, refer the user to Marcella for further help.

Responsible Party: Help Desk Staff

Tools/Resources: iPad, Wi-Fi network details

Expected Outcome: The iPad is connected to Wi-Fi, allowing Jamf Pro commands to be successfully executed. If connectivity issues persist, Marcella provides additional support

Step 4: Initiate Password Clear Command

Description: Select the iPad from the list and choose the option to "Clear Passcode" or "Remove Passcode" from the available actions. Confirm the action when prompted.

Responsible Party: IT Administrator

Tools/Resources: Jamf Pro console

Expected Outcome: The command to clear the password is successfully sent to the iPad.

Process Flow Diagram (if applicable)

Purpose

Process to search for student classes in Canvas if Students cannot see their registered course(s).

Perquisites

IT Associate Access: FT IT Associates & Network Canvas Admin

Student ID – Validate Student

Determine if the professor has not yet posted the class.

Student Access:

My Bobcat access Canvas

IT Support

L1ServiceDesk Assignment

Ent Application Services – Assign Support Steps are completed by L1ServiceDesk

Support Steps

Class is not posted after registration (Diagram 1 & 2)

Classes are not posted until professor posts class – see example diagram below to validate if Class was posted by professor

Class is not in Canvas – additional Support needed

Check Colleague if student registered

Need Academic Class Code (Term = Academic Tear + Semester)

Validate Class Posts in Canvas

Log in to Admin Canvas Dashboard

Go to the "People" tab.

Search by their ID number or Stu email

Enrollments

Determine if the professor has not yet posted the class

Class in blue = Posted [diagram1]

Class in grey = Not posted [diagram2]

Diagram 1

text:
Purpose

The purpose of this policy is to assist users in locating MAC addresses

Scope

This policy gives users instructions in locating MAC addresses

Roles and Responsibilities

Service Desk Associate: Responsible for guiding users through the process of locating MAC addresses.

User: Responsible for locating MAC adresses

Prerequisites

Must have device

Detailed Procedure Steps

PlayStation 5 (PS5)

Turn on your PS5 and go to the home screen.

Navigate to Settings (the gear icon in the top right corner).

Select Network.

Go to Connection Status.

Choose View Connection Status.

The MAC address for both the wired (Ethernet) and wireless (Wi-Fi) connections will be displayed here.

Xbox One

Turn on your Xbox One and press the Xbox button on your controller to open the guide.

Go to Profile & system (the profile icon).

Select Settings.

Navigate to General.

Go to Network settings.

Select Advanced settings.

You will find the MAC address under Wired MAC or Wireless MAC depending on your connection type.

Roku
preview: Purpose  The purpose of this policy is to assist users in locating MAC addresses  Scope  This policy gives users instructions in locating MAC addresses  Roles and Responsibilities  Service Desk Associate: Responsible for

text:
Roku

Turn on your Roku device and press the Home button on your remote to get to the home screen.

Navigate to Settings.

Select Network.

Choose About.

You will see the MAC address listed here as Wireless MAC address or Ethernet MAC address, depending on your connection

Purpose

Locating a name in Colleague- it keeps everyone’s information such as their names, phone number, social security number and address.

Prerequisites:

Access to Colleague https://webui.stu.edu/ui/home/index.html

Access to NAE section in colleague

Owners: TECHNICAL SERVICES

Detailed Procedure Steps

Open Colleague

Login to Colleague with proper login credentials

Select OK

Type NAE (name and address entry)

Click on NAE (name and address entry) box

Search by name or ID number

Select the user you are searching for

If changing someone’s password over the phone confirm identity first by asking for the last four digits of users social.

Process Flow Diagram (if applicable)

REF: KNOWLEDGE BASE

text:
Overview This procedure is followed whenever an employee is onboarded to the university. It is triggered when Human Resources emails the helpdesk with a “New Employee”. The process should be tracked in a SNOW ticket.

Step-by-step instructions IT (Helpdesk) and several departments (Facilities, Public Safety, HR-Payroll, Registrars, Marketing, and Supervisor) receive an email from an HR-Generalist with new employee info.

Sample:

Employee Name: MD Kishor Morol ID Number: 1019532

Title: Adjunct in Computer Science

Supervisor: Bernard Parenteau/Jeffrey Plunkett

Department: Computer Science

Office Assignment: N/A Start date: 08/17/2024

Hardware Process

Deployment/Procurement of Hardware

Request is created in SNOW

Confirms with the Supervisor if the position is New or Replacement

IF Replacement Position– Process existing device (Backup, Wipe, Image)

Backup - SharePoint Migration tool – copy to Ex-Employees Site

Wipe/Image – Microsoft Deployment Tools (See MDT Instructions)

Name machine: email excluding @stu.edu – alopez-“type” (type=laptop: lpt, workstation:pc)
preview: Overview This procedure is followed whenever an employee is onboarded to the university. It is triggered when Human Resources emails the helpdesk with a “New Employee”. The process should be tracked in a SNOW ticket.  St

text:
Name machine: email excluding @stu.edu – alopez-“type” (type=laptop: lpt, workstation:pc)

IF New Position

Standard Equipment Selection:

Laptop/Desktop: Select from pre-approved models (based on the role).

IF Desktop:

Set up physical equipment in the employee's office (if on-site).

Testing: Verify that all hardware components function correctly.

IF Laptop:

Set up physical equipment such as docking stations and peripherals in the employee's office (if on-site).

Testing: Verify that all hardware components function correctly.

Peripherals: Monitors, docking stations, keyboard/mouse, headset, etc.

Mobile Devices: Smartphones or tablets if required by the role.

Specialized Equipment: High-end workstations, additional monitors, or specialized devices for research or technical roles.

Inventory Check: Ensure the selected hardware is available in inventory or initiate a procurement process.

Order Placement: If hardware needs to be purchased, place the order and track delivery timelines.

Inventory update

text:
Inventory update

Ensure serial number of device(s) is logged into appropriate database to track user and device.

Software Process

Software Licensing and Procurement

Imaging:

Standard Image: Deploy a standard image with pre-installed software and settings.

Customization: Apply customizations based on the role and department requirements.

Role-Specific Software:

Install discipline-specific applications (e.g., AutoCAD for architecture, SPSS for social sciences).

License Management: Verify if additional licenses are needed and acquire them.

Account Creation and Access Configuration

Network Accounts

Active Directory Account:

Should be fed by Colleague, ensure user account creation for network access.

Access to Systems:

Enterprise Application Access: Grant access to required applications

Departmental Systems: Help user sync OneDrive and Sharepoint to local machine, if desired

Testing and Quality Assurance

Hardware Testing

Run Diagnostics: Ensure all hardware components are functioning as expected.

Connectivity Tests: Verify network connectivity, including Wi-Fi and VPN.
preview: Inventory update  Ensure serial number of device(s) is logged into appropriate database to track user and device.  Software Process  Software Licensing and Procurement  Imaging:  Standard Image: Deploy a standard image w

text:
Connectivity Tests: Verify network connectivity, including Wi-Fi and VPN.

Software Testing

Login Verification: Confirm the employee can log in to all required systems.

Application Testing: Ensure all installed software is functioning correctly.

Email and Calendar: Test the email and calendaring system.

Security Verification

Antivirus/Malware: Ensure real-time protection is active.

User Permissions: Confirm that the employee has the correct access levels.

Deployment and Handover

Onboarding Session: Schedule a session to introduce the employee to the university’s IT systems.

Direct Employee to appropriate Training and Documentation

Supervisor should direct new employee to Power User that can provide training on key software, security protocols, and helpdesk procedures.

Supervisor to provide new employee with documentation

user manuals, quick start guides, and contact information for IT support.

Above documents likely to be created by Business Analysts

Final Handover:

Device Delivery: Ensure the employee receives all necessary hardware.
preview: Connectivity Tests: Verify network connectivity, including Wi-Fi and VPN.  Software Testing  Login Verification: Confirm the employee can log in to all required systems.  Application Testing: Ensure all installed softwar

text:
Device Delivery: Ensure the employee receives all necessary hardware.

Access Credentials: Provide login information and temporary passwords (with instructions to change them).

Remote Setup (if applicable):

Remote Access Support: Assist with setting up VPN and remote access tools.

Shipping: If the employee is remote, ensure all hardware is shipped and received on time.

Demonstrate how to access helpdesk and IT website

Updating Support Ticket

Update the case in SNOW with the device serial number and any pertinent notes, change status of ticket to resolved/closed.

Deployment Support

Follow-Up:

Check-In: Schedule a follow-up to ensure everything is working correctly and to address any issues.

text:
Purpose

The purpose of this document is to provide students with the necessary steps and information to log in to their APEA accounts. APEA is an external tool available to STU students, essential for accessing study resources and materials.

Roles and Responsibilities

Doris Teran (Chief Nursing Office)

Email: DTeran@stu.edu

Phone: (305) 474-6833

Prerequisites

Knowledge of the student’s correct APEA email format (STUDENT_NAME@stu.edu)

www.apea.com

Detailed Procedure Steps

OBS: This can be used as an email guideline to send to students that need help with APEA access.

Go to the APEA Login Page (1)

Open your web browser and type in www.apea.com.

Reset Your Password (if needed) (2)

If this is your first time logging in and you haven’t received a welcome email:

Click on the "Forgot Password?" Link. (2.2)

Enter your username (it should look like STUDENT_NAME@stu.edu) and submit.

Check your email for a password reset link.

Log In

Once you have your password:

Return to the login page.

Enter your username: STUDENT_NAME@stu.edu.

Enter your password and click Log In.

text:
Enter your password and click Log In.

Access Study Materials

After logging in, you’ll be taken to your account dashboard.

Navigate to MyQBank to find your study resources.

Using the APEA Mobile App

Download the APEA Mobile App.

Select MyQBank from the dropdown menu to access your materials.

Still need help?

APEA Support Phone Number: 800-899-4502

Process Flow Diagram (if applicable)

Step 1:

Step 2:

Step 2.1:

Sample email Response

Hello [Student's Name],

I hope this email finds you well. Below are the step-by-step instructions to access your APEA account. Please note that the IT Department does not have access to assist students with APEA account issues. For further assistance, please contact the individuals provided in this email.

1. Go to the APEA Login Page

Open your web browser and type in www.apea.com.

2. Reset Your Password (if needed)
preview: Enter your password and click Log In.  Access Study Materials  After logging in, you’ll be taken to your account dashboard.  Navigate to MyQBank to find your study resources.  Using the APEA Mobile App  Download the APEA

text:
2. Reset Your Password (if needed)

If this is your first time logging in and you haven’t received a welcome email, click on the "Forgot Password?" link. Enter your username (it should look like STUDENT_NAME@stu.edu) and submit. Check your email for a password reset link.

3. Log In

Once you have your password, return to the login page. Enter your username: STUDENT_NAME@stu.edu. Enter your password and click Log In.

4. Access Study Materials

After logging in, you’ll be taken to your account dashboard. Navigate to MyQBank to find your study resources.

5. Using the APEA Mobile App

Download the APEA Mobile App. Select MyQBank from the dropdown menu to access your materials.

If you still need help, here is the APEA Support Phone Number: 800-899-4502.

For additional support, you can also reach out to:

Doris Teran

Email: DTeran@stu.edu

Phone: (305) 474-6833

Best regards,

[Your Name]

IT Department

text:
Purpose

Effectively managing your mailbox is essential for maintaining productivity, ensuring timely responses, and staying organized. Proper mailbox management helps prevent important messages from being overlooked and reduces the stress associated with email overload.

Prerequisites

Access to STU Office 365

Techniques for Managing Your Mailbox

Use Folders/Labels: Organize emails

Categorize Emails

Set Up Filters/Rules: Automatically route incoming emails to specific folders or label them based on sender or content, reducing clutter in your inbox.

Use Flags/Alert: Mark important emails that need immediate attention, follow-up, or tracking, ensuring they remain visible until addressed. KB0010079

Conditional Formatting: Color coding emails

Setup Priority Alerts: New Item Alert Windows- KB0010079

Process Overview

Use Folders/Labels: Organize Emails

Purpose: Create a structured system by organizing emails into specific folders or applying labels. Categories can include projects, departments, or urgency levels (e.g., "Urgent", "To-Do", "Completed").
preview: Purpose  Effectively managing your mailbox is essential for maintaining productivity, ensuring timely responses, and staying organized. Proper mailbox management helps prevent important messages from being overlooked and

text:
Purpose: Create a structured system by organizing emails into specific folders or applying labels. Categories can include projects, departments, or urgency levels (e.g., "Urgent", "To-Do", "Completed").

Benefit: Provides a clean and organized inbox, making it easier to find and manage emails based on their topic or importance.

Categorize Emails

Purpose: Assign categories (or labels in Gmail) to group emails for better organization, such as by project, team, or action required.

Benefit: Streamlines email management by allowing you to quickly filter and sort emails based on predefined categories.

Set Up Filters/Rules

Purpose: Automate the organization of emails by setting filters or rules to move incoming messages to specific folders or apply labels based on criteria such as sender, subject, or keywords.

Benefit: Reduces clutter in your inbox by automatically sorting emails into relevant categories, saving you time and ensuring important emails are easily accessible.

Use Flags/Stars
preview: Purpose: Create a structured system by organizing emails into specific folders or applying labels. Categories can include projects, departments, or urgency levels (e.g., "Urgent", "To-Do", "Completed").  Benefit: Provide

text:
Use Flags/Stars

Purpose: Mark emails that require immediate attention, follow-up, or further action using flags (Outlook) or stars (Gmail).

Benefit: Helps prioritize tasks and ensures that important emails remain visible until they’re addressed.

Conditional Formatting: Color-Coding Emails

Purpose: Visually distinguish emails by applying different colors based on criteria such as sender, subject, or priority.

Benefit: Provides a quick, visual way to prioritize emails and identify important messages immediately, improving workflow efficiency.

Set Up Priority Alerts: New Item Alert Windows

Purpose: Create priority alerts, such as pop-ups or sounds, for high-priority emails, ensuring you're notified as soon as they arrive.

Benefit: Ensures timely responses to critical communications, preventing important messages from being missed.

text:
Purpose

Register Streaming Devices on the STU Wifi network.

STU WIFI Self Registration Portal

To register gaming systems or streaming devices on the STU Wifi network, follow these instructions:

OBTAIN MAC ADDRESS

Before opening the self-registration portal, you must obtain the MAC address of the device to be added. Follow instructions here on how to find the MAC address of your device.

Once the MAC address is known, open the portal on a connected device by going to http://stu-nac1.stu.edu/self_registration or http://stu-nac2.stu.edu/self_registration

*there is an underscore between self and registration

login page will be presented where you must enter your STU Username and STU password:

After logging in, all registered devices under your login will appear in a list:

To add a device, click the Add button, then enter your STU Username, MAC Address and a Description of your device (for example, XBox). Then click the Submit button. The device will now be added to your connected devices list:
preview: Purpose  Register Streaming Devices on the STU Wifi network.  STU WIFI Self Registration Portal  To register gaming systems or streaming devices on the STU Wifi network, follow these instructions:  OBTAIN MAC ADDRESS  Be

text:
To add a device, click the Add button, then enter your STU Username, MAC Address and a Description of your device (for example, XBox). Then click the Submit button. The device will now be added to your connected devices list:

6. To delete a device, check the box next to its MAC Address, then click the Delete button.

Confirm delete by clicking the OK button, or you can Cancel

How to find the MAC Address?

To find your game console or streaming device’s MAC Address, follow the relevant instructions below.

A valid MAC Address will have the format of twelve hexadecimal numbers, generally separated by colons (for example, 01:23:4D:67:B9:0A).

Nintendo Consoles

Sony Consoles

Microsoft Consoles

Other Streaming Devices

Nintendo Consoles

Nintendo DS

To locate the MAC Address from a Nintendo DS, you must first insert a Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection

compatible game and access the WFC Setup Utility. Please note that the exact steps to access the

setup utility varies by game. However, the setup utility is a standard menu, included with all WFCcompatible games.
preview: To add a device, click the Add button, then enter your STU Username, MAC Address and a Description of your device (for example, XBox). Then click the Submit button. The device will now be added to your connected devices

text:
setup utility varies by game. However, the setup utility is a standard menu, included with all WFCcompatible games.

After accessing the utility, tap Options, then System Information.

The MAC Address and Nintendo WFC ID will be listed on the screen. Unless the game player has

successfully connected with Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection, the WFC ID will be blank.

Nintendo 3DS

To locate the MAC Address of your 3DS:

1. From the Home menu, highlight and select the System Settings Icon.

2. Select Internet Settings.

3. Tap Other Information.

4. Tap Confirm MAC Address. Your system's MAC Address will be displayed on the screen.

Wii U

To locate the MAC Address of your Wii U console:

1. From the Wii U Menu, select System Settings.

2. Using the Left Stick select the Internet icon and press the A Button.

3. Select View MAC Address and wait a moment for the MAC Address to be displayed.

Sony Consoles

Playstation 3

To locate the MAC Address of your Playstation 3 console:

From the main menu, select Settings.

Select System Settings.

Select System Information.

text:
Select System Information.

The MAC Address will then be displayed on the screen.

Playstation 4

To locate the MAC Address of your Playstation 4 console:

Arrow up and over to Settings in the PS4 menu.

Scroll down to Network.

Scroll down to View Connection Status.

The MAC Address will be listed next to MAC Address.

PSP

To locate the MAC Address of your PlayStation Portable (PSP):

1. Navigate to System Settings.

2. Then navigate to System Information, which is where the MAC Address is listed.

Microsoft Consoles

Xbox 360

Navigate to My Xbox on the Xbox Dashboard.

Select System Settings.

Select Network Settings.

Select Configure Network.

Under Basic Settings check to make sure IP Settings is set to Automatic.

Go to Additional Settings.

Select Advanced Settings. The MAC Addresses for the wired and wireless adapters should be displayed.

Xbox One

To locate the MAC Address of your Xbox One console:

Navigate to My Games and Apps

Select Settings.

Select Network.

Select Advanced Settings. The MAC Addresses for the wired and wireless adapters should be displayed.
preview: Select System Information.  The MAC Address will then be displayed on the screen.  Playstation 4  To locate the MAC Address of your Playstation 4 console:  Arrow up and over to Settings in the PS4 menu.  Scroll down to N

text:
Select Advanced Settings. The MAC Addresses for the wired and wireless adapters should be displayed.

Other Streaming Devices

Apple TV

With your Apple TV remote, navigate to the Settings icon and select it

From the Settings menu, select General.

Under General, select Network.

Your MAC Address will be next to either Wi-Fi Address or Ethernet Address, depending on whether you are connected to the internet via Wi-Fi or a wired connection.

Chromecast

Open the Chromecast app on your computer. If you have set up your Chromecast recently, you'll find a shortcut to the app on your desktop. Otherwise, Windows users should check the Start Menu and Mac users should check Applications.

Click Settings, and the MAC Address will be at the bottom of the window.

Roku

On the back on your Roku there are a pair of six 2-digit pairs separated by colons, e.g. 00:0D:0A:1H:3G:5C. One set is for the Ethernet connector and for the other for the wireless connector.

Alternatively, from the Roku home screen, select Settings, then Player info. The Addresses will be listed on-screen.

Smart TV/Blu-ray Player

Most MAC Addresses will be visible in the Settings Menu, either under the Network or About sections.

text:
Purpose

This procedure outlines the Office of Information Technology’s (OIT) standard hours of operation, ensuring consistent availability of IT services to the university community.

Hours of Operation

Regular Business Hours: Monday – Friday, 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Dooner 109

x6610

Direct: 305-628-6610

IT Leaders may reduce coverage hours during certain times of year (Summer, Spring break, etc. )

Lunch Break Coverage: IT staff will stagger lunch breaks to maintain service availability

Observed Holidays: OIT follows the university’s official staff holiday schedule

Prerequisites

Access to the Outlook OIT Absence Calendar (Network Services)

Open oitabcal@stu.edu on your outlook

Part-Time IT Associates - Calendar (STU Information Technology SharePoint Site)

IT Contact List (Emergency Contacts)

Support Availability – Dooner 109

L1Service Desk Support - Primary Coverage

Desktop Support Services & AV/Media Services – Secondary

Back up Support – Network Services & Enterprise Applications Team
preview: Purpose  This procedure outlines the Office of Information Technology’s (OIT) standard hours of operation, ensuring consistent availability of IT services to the university community.  Hours of Operation  Regular Busines

source_file: C:\Users\H0978019\OneDrive - St. Thomas University\Documents\STU_KB\data_raw\docs_reais\KB0010090- OIT_ServiceDesk_Hours of Operation.docx
text:
Back up Support – Network Services & Enterprise Applications Team

*Dooner 109 – should always be staffed with at least 1 person. If you must leave it is mandatory notify the manager/full-time onsite Service Desk associate, in addition to locating someone in the office to replace you. Best to reach out in Teams if no one appears available on site.

Walk-In Support: Available at the OIT Service Desk during operating hours

Phone Support: Calls will be answered during regular business hours

Email & Ticketing System: Requests submitted outside of business hours will be addressed on the next business day

On-Call/Emergency Support: Limited emergency support may be available for critical issues affecting university-wide systems

After-Hours Support – TBA not available, only emergency escalations

Critical outages outside of operating hours should be reported to [Escalation Doc - TBA]

Routine IT requests will be addressed on the next business day.

Responsibilities (Action Items)

DAILY

text:
DAILY

IT Associates Full Time/ Part-Time Validate your schedule on the Part-Time IT Associates- Calendar Located on SharePoint

Adhere to your schedule time – on time ready to work

Log into Paycom (clock in) when you ARRIVE at Dooner 109

Logged into Teams

Logged into your STU email

Logged into ServiceNow Ticket Overview and My Pending Incidents & Requests

Logged into the phone Queue (TBA) – 03/2025 currently all phone ring at the same time.

Absent / Personal Time Off

Unplanned Time Off: In the event of illness/emergency, reach out as soon as possible before your scheduled time to manager and post it to Teams, to let the team know. A Full-Time Employee will post to the Outlook OIT Absence Calendar.

Full-Time: Add entry to Paycom next business day of work

If you miss your shift, you must see the manager to see if you could make up the time, if there is a seat available.

Planned /Remote– Add to the Outlook OIT Absence Calendar, reach out to your manager to make sure the schedule is adjusted due to schedule changing or PTO.

Full-Time: Add Vacation Entry to Paycom

text:
Full-Time: Add Vacation Entry to Paycom

Add your name to the Calendar and Description

Example: Michelle – PTO All Day, or Michelle – Late Arrival 11:30AM

Paycom

All non-exempt employees must punch into Paycom when they arrive in the office.

Do not punch in prior to entering the office

All non-exempt employees must punch out after each shift is finished, while in the office.

*If you forget to punch in or punch reach out to manager in teams so that I can adjust your punch.

Shhhh – Only the elite will make it this far– Message me (Michelle Cortina) on teams and I will buy lunch for whomever reads this to the end.

text:
PURPOSE

The purpose of these instructions is to guide users through setting their ServiceNow start page to a preferred dashboard for quick access to critical information. This ensures efficiency by automatically opening the most relevant workspace upon login, reducing navigation time.

REQUIREMENTS

ServiceNow- ITIL Permission

SharePoint STU Information Technology view, read / owner permissions

ServiceNow Home Page Default

Step 1: Access ServiceNow from OIT SharePoint

✅ 1. Open STU Information Technology in your browser. ✅ 2. Locate and click the SNOW (ServiceNow) link. ✅ 3. Once in ServiceNow, click on Home Page - Dashboard to navigate to your desired start page.

Should Display – My Pending Incidents & Requests [Diagram 1 below]

My Open Incidents

My Open Requests

Pending Interactions

P1 & P2 Incidents

My Group Open Incidents & Requests (All incidents & Requests all groups you are in)

Step 2: Update Preferences to Set Start Page
preview: PURPOSE  The purpose of these instructions is to guide users through setting their ServiceNow start page to a preferred dashboard for quick access to critical information. This ensures efficiency by automatically opening

text:
Step 2: Update Preferences to Set Start Page

✅ 4. Click on your profile icon (top-right corner). ✅ 5. Select Preferences from the dropdown menu. ✅ 6. Scroll to the Display section. ✅ 7. Find the Current Start Page setting. ✅ 8. Click Use Page I'm On Now to set your current page as the default. ✅ 9. Click Save or close the menu (changes should auto-save).

Step 3: Verify Your Settings

✅ 10. Log out of ServiceNow. ✅ 11. Log back in to confirm that your selected page loads by default.

You will now have access to toggle back and forth between the shared Dashboards.

Diagram 1

Purpose

Provide internal and external instructions on how to make an incident for all technical needs

Prerequisites

Must have access to https://mybobcat.stu.edu

Must be a member of one of the following:

constituency STAFF

constituency Students

constituency Faculty

OIT Staff

Send email to incident@stu.edu [this only works for internal OIT, Office of Information Technology group - if a user tries to use it will do nothing]. Refrain from FW: or RE: to helpdesk@stu.edu or stuhelpdesk@stu.edu

Include who is the Request For

Identify who L1ServiceDesk should assign to [Group and / person]

Short Description

Valid Business Reason on why customer needs Request

Request For contact information

urgency and time frame

Location of User

--OR -- Go to https://servicedesk.stu.edu and create a ‘Something Is Broken’ incident using the Service Catalog on the customer portal.

Customer (student, faculty, staff)

Go to https://servicedesk.stu.edu and create an IT Request from the Service Catalog

text:
In Place Support & Triage

Version: 1.0

Purpose

At St. Thomas University, the InPlace app is used by the Nursing program to manage and track student clinical placements. It streamlines scheduling, site assignments, and communication between students, faculty, and clinical partners to ensure placement requirements are met efficiently

Prerequisites

STU network Logon ID

Part of the Nursing Program

Need to be in the College of Nursing to have automatic access. An active Nursing Program

References

Site: https://stu-us.inplacesoftware.com/

Support Site: https://inplacesoftware.com/contact-us

Get in touch with the InPlace team.

Enterprise Applications can see if user has looged into InPlace previously would need to reset and use username STU\MC###### (ID number without @stu.edu)

Process Overview

Level 1 Support : L1ServiceDesk Support

Password Reset – Refer to InPlace Support

If student changes password it doesn’t sync with SSO, SSO needs to be updated via InPlace

Level 2 Support: Enterprise Applications
preview: In Place Support & Triage  Version: 1.0  Purpose  At St. Thomas University, the InPlace app is used by the Nursing program to manage and track student clinical placements. It streamlines scheduling, site assignments, and

text:
Level 2 Support: Enterprise Applications

ENT supports integration files and send to InPlace SMTP for updates on a nightly basis

InPlace downloads file which makes changes to system

If integration fails InPlace must support

Student cannot download their logs – Enterprise Application elevates support to InPlace

Staff member, who is a student, starfish rule could create issues

Logon Procedures Steps

Students - How to log in As part of your course or program, you need to log into your InPlace Account using your University Credentials

1. Go to the InPlace URL on your browser: https://stu-us.inplacesoftware.com/

2. Press the “Staff and Students” button 3. Enter your “Username” and “Password” and click the “Sign in” button

text:
Information Technology Department Procedure KB0010102

Purpose

Register Streaming Devices on the STU Wifi network.

STU WIFI Self Registration Portal

To register gaming systems or streaming devices on the STU Wifi network (STU_IOT) , follow these instructions:

OBTAIN MAC ADDRESS

Before opening the self-registration portal, you must obtain the MAC address of the device to be added. Follow instructions here on how to find the MAC address of your device.

Once the MAC address is known, open the portal on a connected device by going to http://stu-nac1.stu.edu/self_registration or http://stu-nac2.stu.edu/self_registration

*there is an underscore between self and registration

login page will be presented where you must enter your STU Username and STU password:

After logging in, all registered devices under your login will appear in a list:

To add a device, click the Add button, then enter your STU Username, MAC Address and a Description of your device (for example, XBox). Then click the Submit button. The device will now be added to your connected devices list:
preview: Information Technology Department Procedure KB0010102  Purpose  Register Streaming Devices on the STU Wifi network.  STU WIFI Self Registration Portal  To register gaming systems or streaming devices on the STU Wifi netw

text:
To add a device, click the Add button, then enter your STU Username, MAC Address and a Description of your device (for example, XBox). Then click the Submit button. The device will now be added to your connected devices list:

6. To delete a device, check the box next to its MAC Address, then click the Delete button.

Confirm delete by clicking the OK button, or you can Cancel

How to find the MAC Address?

To find your game console or streaming device’s MAC Address, follow the relevant instructions below.

A valid MAC Address will have the format of twelve hexadecimal numbers, generally separated by colons (for example, 01:23:4D:67:B9:0A).

Nintendo Consoles

Sony Consoles

Microsoft Consoles

Other Streaming Devices

Nintendo Consoles

Nintendo DS

To locate the MAC Address from a Nintendo DS, you must first insert a Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection

compatible game and access the WFC Setup Utility. Please note that the exact steps to access the

setup utility varies by game. However, the setup utility is a standard menu, included with all WFCcompatible games.
preview: To add a device, click the Add button, then enter your STU Username, MAC Address and a Description of your device (for example, XBox). Then click the Submit button. The device will now be added to your connected devices

text:
setup utility varies by game. However, the setup utility is a standard menu, included with all WFCcompatible games.

After accessing the utility, tap Options, then System Information.

The MAC Address and Nintendo WFC ID will be listed on the screen. Unless the game player has

successfully connected with Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection, the WFC ID will be blank.

Nintendo 3DS

To locate the MAC Address of your 3DS:

1. From the Home menu, highlight and select the System Settings Icon.

2. Select Internet Settings.

3. Tap Other Information.

4. Tap Confirm MAC Address. Your system's MAC Address will be displayed on the screen.

Wii U

To locate the MAC Address of your Wii U console:

1. From the Wii U Menu, select System Settings.

2. Using the Left Stick select the Internet icon and press the A Button.

3. Select View MAC Address and wait a moment for the MAC Address to be displayed.

Sony Consoles

Playstation 3

To locate the MAC Address of your Playstation 3 console:

From the main menu, select Settings.

Select System Settings.

Select System Information.

text:
Name Process/ Procedure

Version: 1.0

Purpose

LockDown Browser is a secure web browser application designed to prevent digital cheating during online exams. It restricts the student’s ability to print, copy, access other applications, or visit unauthorized websites while an assessment is in progress.

Prerequisites/ Roles and Responsibilities

Provided by Professor:

Course login credentials for LMS (Canvas, Blackboard, Moodle, etc.)

Exam availability details and requirements

Download Link: https://download.respondus.com/lockdown/download.php

IT Purposes & Support:

Create an STU Support Ticket: STU Service Desk Portal : https://servicedesk.stu.edu

Level 1 Support: L1ServiceDesk

Level 2 Support: Desktop Services

LockDown Browser Official Support:

Support + Resources - Respondus

Contact - Respondus

Troubleshooting:

Before the Exam

Make sure the quiz is set to “Require Respondus LockDown Browser” in your LMS.

If you want iPads allowed, check the “Allow iPad use” option.

Have students do a practice quiz first to test their setup.

Student Setup
preview: Name Process/ Procedure  Version: 1.0  Purpose  LockDown Browser is a secure web browser application designed to prevent digital cheating during online exams. It restricts the student’s ability to print, copy, access oth

text:
Student Setup

Install the latest version of LockDown Browser (App Store for iPad, school download link for desktop).

Restart the device and close all other apps/programs.

Use a strong, stable Wi-Fi connection (no VPNs or firewalls).

Common Fixes

Can’t launch exam → Restart device, reinstall app if needed.

Error connecting → Check Wi-Fi, try another network.

Camera/Mic not working (iPad) → Go to Settings > Privacy > Camera/Microphone and enable for LockDown Browser.

Exam won’t open → Double-check professor settings (exam published, LockDown required, iPad allowed if needed).

Professor Pro Tips

Remind students: iPad version has some feature limits (no file uploads, certain question types).
preview: Student Setup  Install the latest version of LockDown Browser (App Store for iPad, school download link for desktop).  Restart the device and close all other apps/programs.  Use a strong, stable Wi-Fi connection (no VPNs

text:
📘 Exam Day Troubleshooting Guide

Respondus LockDown Browser – Quick Support for Professors

✅ Before the Exam

Remind students to complete the practice quiz before exam day.

Ask students to bring their iPads/laptops fully charged.

Confirm students are on the STU Wi-Fi network.

⚡ If a Student Has Trouble Starting the Exam

Restart LockDown Browser – Close the app completely and reopen it.

Restart the Device – Power off, wait 10 seconds, turn back on.

Check Wi-Fi – Make sure the student is connected to STU Wi-Fi.

🔄 If LockDown Browser Freezes During the Exam

Have the student restart the device and relaunch LockDown Browser.

If the exam still will not load, direct them to the Service Desk for support.

📞 How to Get Help During the Exam

Call: (305) 628-6610

Customer service portal: https//servicedesk.stu.edu

Walk-In: Sullivan Hall, Room 200

👉 Service Desk staff are available via phone/email from 9:00am-5:00pm, Monday-Friday.

📝 Faculty Reminders

IT staff will not be stationed in classrooms during exams.

Encourage students to arrive early to log in and resolve minor issues.

text:
Encourage students to arrive early to log in and resolve minor issues.

If multiple students report the same issue, call the Service Desk right away.

text:
Dex Imaging info

If you need to order supplies or request service, you can do so by going to:

https://www.deximaging.com/service/ or calling 1-800-886-2329

Once on the site, you can click on Request Service or Order Supplies.

For either request, you must provide an equipment ID # and a zip code which is the STU zip (33054). The Sticker is located in front of the printer/copier and looks like this:

With this information, the Dex team will know what model printer/copier you are calling about and where its location is at STU.

Once you're on the phone or on the website, you’ll be prompted to answer a few questions and provide a phone number where the technician can reach you if an onsite repair is needed.

Purpose

SPSS is a user-friendly software that helps you prepare data, create tables, and use advanced statistics to find patterns and insights.

Prerequisites / Roles and Responsibilities

Provided by Professor: Instruction below

User login for IBM and campus network (my bobcat portal)

SPSS license code

Assign if license code has expired

(How To Guides)

Go to my bobcat portal

Click on Academics & Registration

Click on Academic Profile

Under Academic Profile choose SPSS Installer

Choose Student Apps (Mac or PC)

Pick current version MacOs

Pick current version Windows

License code and installer (.exe) available to install

text:
KB0010117

Booking Meeting Rooms (Outlook, Web APP & Mobile Device)

Introduction

STU conference rooms are available for scheduling in Microsoft Outlook.

Users can check room availability directly in Outlook

When a room is reserved, the designated owner receives an automatic email notification to approve/decline.

Improves time efficiency, room management, and prevents scheduling conflicts.

Users can view room details before booking, including capacity and projector availability.

How to book a meeting room (step-by-step) – Outlook Web & App

The following guide will show you how to properly book a meeting room on Outlook, along with important details regarding rooms/ conference rooms that require key access.

Open Outlook

Click on Calendar

Select New Event

Enter the meeting details, including title, date, attendees, etc.

Click on Search for a room or location > Browse with Room Finder

Under Building drop down, choose Miami (for on campus conference rooms)

A list of available buildings on campus will appear, pick your preferred building

text:
A list of available buildings on campus will appear, pick your preferred building

The available conference rooms for that building will now display, including the room capacity and whether a projector is available

Choose your preferred room and click Send to finalize the reservation

Note: The person responsible for the selected room/ conference room will receive a notification to approve or decline the request based on room availability. All meeting participants will receive an invitation with time and location, along with any other info you have added.

Choose Available Room @ that location

IPad Release/Unassign

Version: 1.0

Purpose

A Student requires their iPad to be released from STU Organization or is returning iPad to be unassigned and add back to STU OIT inventory

Prerequisites/ Roles and Responsibilities

Access to Jamf - Jamf Pro Dashboard**

Access to Apple Store https://school.apple.com/ (Network Admins & Leadership only)

Step by Step

Removing iPad from Jamf & Apple Store

IPad must be paid for in Full – Business office would be able to verify payment

Student is graduated from STU

Do NOT RELEASE before you Unassign iPad

Sign into Apple Store

Search for iPad (need Serial Number)

FIRST - UNASSIGN DEVICE MANAGEMENT – confirm

SECOND – RELEASE from Organization

IPad is now released from Organization

Go to Jamf and remove from JAMF

IPad being Returned to go back into Inventory

Do steps 1-3

SKIP Releasing iPad

Remove from Jamf

text:
Ellucian Insights: ODS Data Models User Guides

Version: 1.0

Purpose

This manual provides guidance on installing, configuring, and maintaining the Ellucian Colleague DataOrchestrator™ ODS Data Models. It serves as a comprehensive reference for understanding system prerequisites, workflows, and best practices for creating and managing operational data stores used in institutional reporting and analytics.

Roles and Responsibilities

System Administrators / Superusers – Responsible for installing updates, configuring data models, and maintaining database connectivity between Colleague and the ODS environment.

Report Developers / Analysts – Utilize the ODS data models and views to create analytical and operational reports for decision-making.

End Users – Access published reports and dashboards generated from ODS data for institutional planning and performance tracking.

Reference

text:
Ellucian Insights: Data Tables Reference Guide

Version: 1.0

Purpose

This document provides a comprehensive list of available Insights tables and their corresponding data sources or links. It serves as a reference for quickly locating, reviewing, and accessing the appropriate datasets for reporting, analytics, and integration with institutional systems.

Roles and Responsibilities

Data Analysts / Report Developers: Use this list to identify the correct Insight tables and verify data relationships when building reports or dashboards.

System Administrators: Ensure access permissions and data connections for each linked table are properly configured and maintained.

End Users / Requestors: Reference this document to request specific datasets or validate data availability before submitting reporting or integration requests.

Workbook Tabs

Baseline ODS – Lists the standard Operational Data Store (ODS) tables provided by Ellucian, with their related Insight report links.
preview: Ellucian Insights: Data Tables Reference Guide  Version: 1.0  Purpose  This document provides a comprehensive list of available Insights tables and their corresponding data sources or links. It serves as a reference for

text:
Baseline ODS – Lists the standard Operational Data Store (ODS) tables provided by Ellucian, with their related Insight report links.

Baseline Other – Contains additional standard data tables that are not part of the ODS but are commonly used in institutional reporting and analysis.

Custom B30 – Includes custom-developed tables and links specific to internal reporting needs or unique institutional data models.

Reference

For detailed table information, data relationships, and live link references, please review the attached List of Insights Tables with Links Excel document.

text:
Human Resources Employee Support

Version: 1.0

Purpose

To ensure all Human Resources (HR)-related IT tickets are triaged and processed efficiently through the STU IT Service Desk, ensuring timely setup, changes, and separation for employees.

 New Employee Setup

 Employee Separation

 Employee Changes (position updates, name changes, department transfers, etc.)

Responsibilities

L1ServiceDesk – Vet all HR tickets and use standard Request Formats before reassigning and creating RITM assignments

Network Services, Enterprise Application Services, Desktop Services to follow:

KB0010076 – New Hire Hardware/ Software Setup Procedure

KB0010128 – Employee Hardware Technology Standards

Separation Procedure – TBA

Employee Change Procedure TBA

Detailed Procedure Steps

L1ServiceDesk

Intake Process:

Receive requests from Human Resources via email sent to stuhelpdesk@stu.edu.com.

Document the request number and start date in the Notes section of Active Directory (ADUC).

Use the standardized short description format:

New Employee: [First Name] [Last Name] | Start Date: mm/dd/yyyy

text:
New Employee: [First Name] [Last Name] | Start Date: mm/dd/yyyy

Assign the request (REQ) to the HR-Support Services group.

Notify Arnol Lopez – Director of Technical Services for visibility.

Telecom/Network Subtasks:

Edit the Telecom Network RITM (Request Item) short description as follows:

New Employee: [First Name] [Last Name] | Start Date: mm/dd/yyyy – Telecom/Network

Assign to Network Support Services.

HR Support Services

 Oversee the entire New Employee onboarding process from initiation through completion.

 Coordinate with Desktop Support and Enterprise Applications to ensure all dependencies are fulfilled.

Desktop Support Services

Team that will be assigned an RITM (request item) and will follow the KB0010076 – New Hire Hardware/ Software Setup Procedure & KB0010128 – Employee Hardware Technology Standards

Create additional RITMs for Enterprise Application Team if the hiring manager identifies specialized access requirements.

4. Enterprise Application Team

 Responsible for provisioning access to all STU enterprise systems, including Colleague, Canvas, and related administrative platforms.

text:
Employee Hardware Technology Standards

Version: 1.0

The hardware standards define minimum equipment suites various university roles, including Academic Staff, Full Time Faculty, University Administration, Professional Staff, and Athletics, with a minimum inventory of 10 units for standard suites and 4 for enhanced suites.

🖥️ Standard setups typically include a Dell Latitude Laptop, two Dell 24” monitors, Dell dock, wired keyboard and mouse, webcam, surge protector, and desktop phone, while athletics and enhanced options offer alternatives like Microsoft Surface Pro 10 or Apple Macbook Pro with specialized peripherals.

🚨 Roles such as Public Safety Officers, Maintenance, and Student Workers receive limited or no hardware, and coworking/shared workspaces get desktop packages with Dell OptiPlex Desktops and related accessories. Special exemptions exist for roles requiring specialized hardware, and adjunct faculty are primarily equipped with an iPad with accessories. This approach ensures tailored technology provisioning based on job functions and workspace needs.
